title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, bacon, and black pepper.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
summary: Chunks of grilled chicken (tikka) cooked in a smooth buttery & creamy tomato based gravy.

title: Kosua ne Meko
summary: Kosua ne Meko is a popular Ghanaian street food consisting of hard-boiled eggs paired with a fiery, fresh pepper relish (Meko).

title: Falafel
summary: Falafel is a popular Middle Eastern street food consisting of deep-fried balls or patties made from ground chickpeas, fava beans, or a mixture of both, blended with fresh herbs and spices.

title: Kebab
summary: A kebab is a diverse family of roasted or grilled meat dishes that originated in the Middle East, generally consisting of marinated meat, fish, or vegetables roasted on a skewer over an open fire.

title: Cochinita Pibil
summary: Cochinita Pibil is a traditional, slow-roasted pork dish hailing from the Yucat√°n Peninsula in Mexico, deeply rooted in Mayan culture.

title: Naan
summary: Naan is a leavened, oven-baked, or tawa-fried flatbread that is a staple in the cuisines of Iran, Central Asia, and South Asia.

title: Lomo Saltado
summary: Lomo Saltado is a Peruvian beef stir fry made with fries. Tender sliced steak, onions, and tomatoes in sauce.

title: Gambas al ajillo
summary: Gambas al ajillo, or Spanish garlic shrimp, is a classic, rapid-cooking tapa that features succulent prawns swimming in a hot, garlicky olive oil sauce.

title: Taco
summary: A traditional Mexican dish consisting of a small hand-sized corn- or wheat-based tortilla topped with a filling.

title: Ceviche
summary: Ceviche is a popular Latin American cold dish made from raw fish or shellfish marinated in citrus juice (typically lime or lemon) and seasonings like salt, onions, and chili peppers.

title: Tom Kha Gai
summary: Tom Kha Gai is a popular, creamy Thai soup made with coconut milk, chicken, and a heavy dose of galangal, a root similar to ginger.
